intro: Hieracium pollaplasium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and produces showy yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a creeping growth habit with stolons that can form dense mats. Due to its attractive flowers and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
